payload.name: defeasible
payload.core: Conclusions can be defeated by counterevidence or stronger rules. Tracks priorities and strength relations between competing arguments. More explicit about conflict resolution than plain defaults.
proc: identify applicable rules: gather all potentially relevant rules
construct arguments: chain rules to support conclusions
map conflicts: find arguments attacking each other
apply priorities: determine which attacker wins each conflict
compute extensions: derive warranted conclusions from undefeated arguments
check: defeat direction determined for each conflict

diff.default: models rule conflicts vs assumes isolated defaults
diff.belief-revision: operates on rules vs on propositions

signals: whose rule wins reflects power not relevance

ex.sit: Rules: employees get standard leave; managers get extended leave; senior managers get unlimited leave. Person X is employee, manager, and senior manager.
steps: X triggers all three rules, conclusions conflict
priority by specificity: senior > manager > employee
ex.insight: specificity resolves without ad-hoc exception clauses
